entry.title: Rescuers step up hunt for bodies in quake-hit Nepal trekking village
Engineers inspect quake-damaged homes in Nepal's capital
entry.summary: An elderly Nepalese walks past a damaged temple performing rituals to end the mourning period of a family member who died in the April 25 earthquake, in Bhaktapur, Nepal, Wednesday, May 6, 2015.

entry.title: Rolling Stones' Jagger, Wood record Nepal quake charity single
entry.summary: The track, entitled "Look into Your Heart" will raise funds for charity Save The Children's Nepal Earthquake Appeal.

entry.title: Engineers inspecting quake-damaged homes in Nepal's capital
entry.summary: KATHMANDU, Nepal (AP) - More than a thousand engineers are checking damaged houses in Nepal's capital and advising people about whether they are safe.

entry.title: Nepal's earthquake highlights village exodus of the young
entry.summary:
Now, however, some in rural Nepal wonder if they'll lose even the young ones who've stayed, complicating not only the huge job of rebuilding after the quake but also the task of improving village life in one of the world's poorest countries.

Today, about 6 million Nepalis, or about 22 percent of the country's 27.8 million people, live and work outside its borders, according to Krishna Prasad Dhakal, Nepal's deputy ambassador to India.

entry.title: Nepal's earthquake highlights exodus of young people from poor villages
entry.summary: She points to one house after another nestled in the green hills, most shattered from the massive earthquake that hit Nepal last month.

entry.title: 60 bodies recovered in Nepal valley hit by quake, mudslide
entry.summary: In this Friday, May 1, 2015 photo provided by Nepal Army, rubble from a mudslide covers the Langtang Valley in Nepal.

entry.title: 60 bodies recovered in Nepal valley hit by quake, mudslide
entry.summary: The Langtang Valley, about 60 kilometers (35 miles) north of Nepal's capital, Kathmandu, is now about a two-day hike from the nearest town because the landslide has blocked nearby roads.

entry.title: Bad weather disrupts links with avalanche-hit Nepal village
entry.summary: Meanwhile, a row has broken out between Nepal and some international agencies over the handling of aid that poured into the country after the earthquake, with each side blaming the other for confusion and delays in getting help to victims.

entry.title: Advance team for 80 medical volunteers arrives in Nepal
entry.summary: The American aid agency's acting administrator, Alfonso Lenhardt, also is in Nepal visiting earthquake-hit areas.

entry.title: 1 Spaniard confirmed dead in Nepal earthquake, officials say
entry.summary: Madrid (AP) - The Spanish Foreign Ministry says one Spaniard has died in the earthquake that devastated Nepal late last month.

entry.title: After Nepal quake, time is ripe to push for safer buildings, experts say
entry.summary: Margareta Wahlstrom, head of the UNISDR, told the Thomson Reuters Foundation she was "quite convinced" that initiatives to reduce the risk of disasters in Nepal must have helped limit loss of life in the quake.

entry.title: 200 could have been killed on Himalayan trail buried in Nepal quake
entry.summary:
Rescuers were digging Tuesday through thousands of tons of earth from a quake-triggered mudslide in Nepal that wiped out an entire village along a popular Himalayan trekking route and killed at least 60 people.

While helicopters allow easy access, they remain in short supply because of aid missions across the quake-affected parts of Nepal.

entry.title: Nepal relief effort intensifies as toll rises to 7,557
entry.summary: His comments came after the National Emergency Operation Centre said the total number of dead had now reached 7,557 while 14,536 were injured in the 7.8-magnitude quake, Nepal's deadliest in more than 80 years.

entry.summary: The valley and its little village of Langtang are about 35 miles north of Nepal's capital, Kathmandu.

entry.title: Bad weather disrupts links with avalanche-hit Nepal village

entry.summary: Nepal government on Monday urged foreign rescue workers in the quake-hit capital to return home.

entry.title: Nepal: We will need huge foreign support for reconstruction
entry.summary: Hundreds of people have visited Buddhists shrines and monasteries in Nepal's quake-wracked Kathmandu on the birthday of Gautama Buddha to pray for the country and the people who suffered during April 25 earthquake.

entry.title: Nepal: We will need huge foreign support for reconstruction
entry.summary: Since the April 25 earthquake, 4,050 rescue workers from 34 different nations have flown to Nepal to help in rescue operations, provide emergency medical care and distribute food and other necessities.

entry.title: Centenarian survives Nepal quake, worries he's testing fate
entry.summary: Funchu Tamang's ordeal is yet another of the extraordinary stories of resilience and survival coming out of Nepal after it was rocked by a 7.8-magnitude quake on April 25.

entry.title: The Latest on Nepal: EU Approves Millions in Funding Support
entry.summary: The European Union has approved 20 million euros ($22 million) in financial support and emergency aid to help Nepal deal with the April 25 earthquake.

entry.title: The Latest on Nepal: EU approves millions in funding support
entry.summary: The government says the death toll from the April 25 earthquake in Nepal has climbed to 7,365, including six foreigners and 45 Nepalese found over the weekend on a popular trekking route.

entry.title: Everest climbing season likely over as Sherpas refuse to rebuild route
entry.summary: KATHMANDU, Nepal -- Sherpas in Nepal have refused to rebuild a climbing route on Mount Everest that was destroyed by an earthquake-triggered avalanche more than a week ago, a decision likely to end this year's climbing season.

entry.summary: There have been reports of cracks on the runway and other problems at the only international airport in Nepal and the only one capable of handling jetliners.

entry.title: 101-year-old man found after Nepal quake
entry.summary:
"One of the big challenges of working in Nepal, and we knew that this would happen should a major earthquake happen here, is the nature of the terrain," the UN humanitarian chief Valerie Amos said in Kathmandu.

"Remarkably, few modern, concrete, buildings have been affected in the capital," said Nepal expert and former UN official John Bevan in a blog post this week.

entry.title: Quake hobbles Nepal, so villagers fend for selves
entry.summary: A week after the magnitude-7.8 earthquake hit Nepal near here, in the central Gorkha district, people in many villages along the roads have stopped waiting for the government to bring help.

entry.title: The Latest on Nepal: India Sending Tents for Quake Victims
entry.summary: Thapa said Sunday that another 13,000 tents given by donors in Kolkata, the capital of West Bengal state, were also being transported to Nepal, India's northern neighbor.

entry.title: The Latest on Nepal: India sending tents for quake victims
entry.summary:
Responding to the Nepalese government's plea for temporary shelters in the wake of the massive earthquake, an Indian state government is sending 100,000 tents to Nepal.

With monsoon rains expected in a few weeks, Nepal has pleaded with donors to send tents and temporary shelters for earthquake victims who have been living in the open for more than a week, with their homes damaged by the April 25 quake.

entry.title: Damaged by Deadly Quake, Fate of Nepal Heritage Unsure
entry.summary: Among the landmarks destroyed in the capital was the iconic, nine-story Dharahara Tower, which was topped by a statue of Shiva - the god of destruction in Hinduism, the predominant religion among Nepal's 28 million people.

entry.title: Damaged by deadly quake, fate of Nepal heritage unsure

entry.summary: Nepal police say the death toll from last week's magnitude-7.8 earthquake has climbed to 6,841, as more reports come in from remote areas and rescue workers dig out more bodies from under the rubble.

entry.title: Damaged, ruined by deadly quake, fate of Nepal's beloved heritage sites in doubt

entry.title: Relief goods for Nepal quake victims held up at customs: UN

entry.title: Aid still scarce in Nepal's remote villages as anger grows
entry.summary: Majuwa,Nepal: With help still not reaching some isolated villages a week after Nepal's devastating earthquake, a top international aid official said Saturday that more helicopters were needed to get assistance to the farthest reaches of this Himalayan nation.

entry.title: Aid still scarce in Nepal's remote villages as anger grows

entry.title: Aid still scarce in Nepal's remote villages as anger grows
The Latest on Nepal: Some still waiting for aid to reach
entry.summary: A week after the devastating earthquake, life is limping back to normal in Nepal with residents visiting temples on the first Saturday after the quake, a day normally reserved for temple visits.

entry.title: In Nepal, the devout see divine anger in the devastation wrought by massive earthquake
entry.summary:
But among many of Nepal's most devoutly religious, the chaos and destruction wrought a week ago by a massive earthquake makes one thing clear: The gods are angry.

Now, in the shadow of some of Nepal's holiest mountaintop temples, many find comfort in the notion that there was a divine and just cause behind the tragedy that has killed thousands and left hundreds of thousands more homeless and destitute.

"It's a warning from the gods to the politicians: Change yourselves, or who knows what will happen," said Ishwar Nath Yogi, the 51-year-old high priest at Gorkha Kalika, a revered temple to the goddess Kali and the birthplace of Nepal's first king.

Three-fourths of Nepal's 27 million people consider themselves Hindu, and the religion has a deep connection to this rugged Himalayan land dotted with countless temples and shrines.

entry.title: Thousands still missing after deadly Nepal quake
entry.summary: KATHMANDU - Thousands of people were still missing in Nepal on Friday as food and help began to trickle through to those stranded in remote areas after last week's earthquake, which killed at least 6,250.

entry.title: The Latest on Nepal: Quake Death Toll Climbs Past 6,600
A Week After Earthquake, Nepal Still Needs Tents and Food
entry.summary:
Nepal's government renewed its appeal to international donors to send tents, tarpaulins and basic food supplies in the wake of last weekend's devastating earthquake, saying some of the items being sent are of little use.

Aid workers still face "immense logistical challenges," U.N. humanitarian chief Valerie Amos said Friday, noting that the scale of the devastation in Nepal would be an obstacle for any government.

entry.title: Nearly a week after quake, Nepal still needs tents, food

entry.title: U.S. Marines begin operations in quake-struck Nepal
entry.summary: The U.S. military would help manage the growing piles of relief supplies clogging Nepal's only international airport, which has struggled to distribute all the aid arriving from around the world since the earthquake.

entry.title: Nepal quake could have been much worse: Here's why

entry.title: Nepal quake could have been much worse: Here's why

entry.title: Nepal quake could have been much worse: Here's why
entry.summary: This is a huge loss of life, but far less than recent estimates that 100,000 people might die in Nepal's next major earthquake.

entry.title: Nepal quake could have been much worse: Here's why
entry.summary:
"It could have been so much worse," says Miyamoto, head of a global earthquake and structural engineering firm, who flew to Nepal soon after he heard about last weekend's 7.8 magnitude quake.

KATHMANDU, Nepal (AP) - The structural engineer strides through Kathmandu's old city, past buildings reduced to rubble, buildings whose facades are cracked in dozens of places, like the fractured shell of a hardboiled egg.

The Nepal quake released 16 times the energy of the 2010 Haiti earthquake, where death estimates ranged from 100,000 to 300,000, yet the death toll in Nepal now stands at more than 6,000.

entry.title: Nepal earthquake: Australian survivors fly into Bangkok
entry.summary:
Camille Thomas and her best friend Grace Graham walked for hours in bare feet after Saturday's Nepal earthquake.

Nepal quake survivor Camille Thomas, 18, from Victoria's Apollo Bay, breaks down as she is reunited with her mother Kate Thomas at Bangkok airport after arriving on an RAAF evacuation flight.

Tony Perry, 37, from Sydney said Australia's effort to send tonnes of relief supplies to Nepal and to evacuate survivors "makes you feel proud to be Australian."

entry.title: Studios scrutinize disaster film marketing in wake of Nepal

The powerful earthquake Saturday in Nepal killed more than 5,000 people, injured twice that many and left tens of thousands of people homeless.

In upcoming promos, the studio will be including information on how to help the relief efforts in Nepal and also how to prepare for natural disasters.

had already planned public service announcements about preparedness around the marketing of the film starring Dwayne Johnson and Carla Gugino but adjusted and accelerated those efforts after Nepal.

entry.summary:
Ballinger said two reasons were cited: Safety concerns over possible additional earthquakes and solidarity with Nepal and the Sherpas.

President Barack Obama has spoken to Prime Minister Sushil Koirala of Nepal to express sympathy over the thousands of deaths and vast destruction.

They discussed the ongoing efforts by U.S. civilian and military personnel to assist the government of Nepal and international organizations in the disaster response efforts, including provision of rescue and logistics support.

The U.N.'s humanitarian coordinator for Nepal, Jamie McGoldrick, said the response to date was encouraging, but those efforts need to be maintained, especially in remote areas.

Brice said he met with the Nepal Mountaineering Association and the Minister of the Ministry of Tourism on Wednesday and received permission to fly loads to Camp 1 after helicopters were free from rescue operations.

entry.summary: The U.N. says the disaster has affected 8.1 million people - more than a fourth of Nepal's population of 27.8 million - and that 1.4 million needed food assistance.

entry.title: 'We are hungry:' Aid reaches epicenter, Nepal toll tops 5000
entry.summary: Unlike in Nepal's capital, where most buildings were spared complete collapse, the tiny hamlets clinging to the remote mountainsides of Gorkha District have been ravaged.

entry.title: Nepal quake toll tops 5,000 as aid reaches epicenter area
entry.summary: An Indian Army doctor helps an injured woman drink water after she was evacuated from higher reaches of mountains by Nepalese army, in Kathmandu, Nepal, Wednesday, April 29, 2015.

entry.title: The Latest on Nepal: 1st Spanish evacuees return home
entry.summary: The first aid shipments reached a hilly district near the epicenter of Nepal's earthquake, a U.N. food agency official said, and distribution of food and medicine would start Wednesday, five days after the quake struck.

entry.title: The Latest on Nepal: Banks, ATMs reopen in Kathmandu
entry.summary:
Nepalese people sit atop buses as they head to their villages in Kathmandu, Nepal, Wednesday, April 29, 2015.

Nepalese people pack their belongings to go back home after sleeping on open grounds for four nights to be safe from earthquake in Kathmandu, Nepal, Wednesday, April 29, 2015.

entry.title: The Latest on Nepal: Banks, ATMs reopen in Kathmandu
entry.summary:
Nepalese people block traffic and shout slogans against the government as they protest the slow pace of aid delivery for the earthquake affected in Kathmandu, Nepal, Wednesday, April 29, 2015.

Nepalese residents buy fresh produce at a vegetable market early morning in Kathmandu, Nepal, Wednesday, April 29, 2015.

While many villages across Nepal affected by Saturday's earthquake are still waiting for rescue and relief teams, life in the capital, Kathmandu, is slowly returning to normal.

A man pulled from the rubble of a collapsed building in Kathmandu more than three days after the deadly Nepal earthquake says he drank his own urine to survive.

entry.title: Everest climbers forced to quit last year to get new permits
Nepal quake survivors recount horror
entry.summary: Len Forder said his 20-year-old daughter Ballantyne, who was volunteering at an orphanage in Nepal, managed to contact her family on Sunday.

entry.title: Luxury hotel in Nepal turns away locals, only open for wealthy tourists
Following deadly Nepal quake and avalanche, climbers say Everest season is over
entry.summary: "The next climbing season is a year away and right now we're more focused on Nepal and taking care of the communities that are there," he said.

entry.title: The Latest on Nepal Quake: Choppers ferry injured to Gorkha
entry.summary: Taiwan's emergency search and rescue team members stand for inspection before heading to Nepal to assist with the earthquake relief effort at the Taoyuan International Airport in Taoyuan, Taiwan, Tuesday, April 28, 2015.

entry.title: The Latest on Nepal Quake: Choppers ferry injured to Gorkha
entry.summary: An elderly woman, injured in Saturday's earthquake, sits outside Bhaktapur public hospital in Bhaktapur, Nepal, Tuesday, April 28, 2015.

entry.title: Helicopters ferry injured from Nepal villages near epicenter
entry.summary:
Preparing to make a push into the most isolated parts of quake-devastated Nepal, soldiers on Tuesday were readying food, water and other emergency supplies to be loaded onto helicopters in this small town near the earthquake's epicenter.

A Nepalese boy talks on a mobile phone near a damaged minaret of a mosque in Kathmandu, Nepal, Tuesday, April 28, 2015.

entry.title: Nepal troops ready aid for remote quake-hit villages
entry.summary:
A helicopter carrying supplies and officials lands at a relief staging area near Saturday's massive earthquake's epicenter in the town of Gorkha, Nepal, Tuesday, April 28, 2015.

Survivors of Saturday's earthquake read newspaper at a makeshift camp in Kathmandu, Nepal, Tuesday, April 28, 2015.

A survivor of Saturday's earthquake plays with his son after spending night in an open ground from fears of earthquake tremors in Kathmandu, Nepal, Tuesday, April 28, 2015.

entry.title: Nepal earthquake: Government ill-equipped to handle earthquake tragedy
entry.summary: Kathmandu: As the death toll from Nepal's massive earthquake passed 4200 on Monday, it was not just drinking water, hospital beds, gasoline, electricity and sanitary facilities that were in short supply.

entry.title: In quake-hit Nepal, rescuers struggle to recover the dead
entry.summary: Nepal is an overwhelmingly Hindu nation and has a small Christian population who comprise 1.4 percent of the country's 27 million people.

entry.title: The Latest on Nepal Quake: Choppers ferry injured to Gorkha
entry.summary: A Nepal police official says at least 4,352 bodies have so far been recovered after last week's massive earthquake that struck just outside of capital Kathmandu.

entry.title: Nepal earthquake moves Kathmandu but Everest height unchanged ? experts
entry.summary: The earthquake that devastated Nepal and left thousands of people dead shifted the earth beneath Kathmandu by up to several metres south, but the height of Mount Everest likely stayed the same, experts said Tuesday.

entry.title: Police say at least 4,352 people have been confirmed dead in Nepal after massive quake
entry.summary: KATHMANDU, Nepal (AP) - Police say at least 4,352 people have been confirmed dead in Nepal after massive quake.

entry.title: In quake-hit Nepal, rescue workers struggle to recover the dead as toll climbs
entry.summary: The estimated death toll from Nepal's earthquake soared past 4,000, and could go much higher if it turns out that vulnerable mountain villages - where information is still scarce and rescue workers are still struggling to reach - were hit hard.

entry.title: In Post-Quake Aid Rush, Nepal Neighbors Jockey for Position
entry.summary: But recent years have seen Nepal forge closer ties with China as a counterweight, and the Nepalese government has assured Beijing that it will not tolerate any anti-China political activism by Tibetans in Nepal.

entry.title: In post-quake aid rush, Nepal neighbors jockey for position
entry.summary: BEIJING (AP) - Wedged between the two rising Asian powers of China and India, landlocked Nepal watched rescuers and offers of help pour in from both sides within hours of an earthquake that killed more than 4,000 people.

entry.title: Nepal earthquake: ADF to airlift survivors as international rescue effort intensifies
entry.summary: Kathmandu: Australians stranded in Nepal following Saturday's devastating earthquake will be airlifted out by the Defence Force as aid agencies warn of deteriorating conditions in some affected parts of the country.

entry.title: Nepal troops ready aid for remote quake-hit villages
entry.summary: Medical and rescue teams from Russia, Japan, France, Switzerland and Singapore were expected in Kathmandu over the coming days, the Nepal army said.

entry.title: AP Interview: UNESCO chief says possible reconstruction of Nepal cultural sites to be assessed
entry.summary: Bokova said another of Nepal's World Heritage sites, Sagarmatha National Park around Mount Everest, is damaged, but the extent is not yet known.

entry.title: Chicago climber OK after Mount Everest avalanche, Nepal earthquake
entry.summary: This aerial photo provided by Shreejan Bhandari, shows Basantapur Durbar Square, in Kathmandu, Nepal, Monday, April 27, 2015.

entry.title: Nepal quake death toll tops 4,000; villages plead for aid
entry.summary: Two teams of U.S. Army Green Beret soldiers happened to be in Nepal when the quake struck, and the 26 Americans - who were training with the Nepalese army - are staying to help with search-and-relief efforts.

entry.title: Quake-aid need acute in Nepal capital, more so in villages
entry.summary:
Nepalese residents carry belongings from their destroyed homes as they walk through debris of Saturday's earthquake, in Bhaktapur on the outskirts of Kathmandu, Nepal, Monday, April 27, 2015.

Portraits and a wall clock is seen hanging on the remains of a house damaged in Saturday's earthquake in Bhaktapur, on the outskirts of Kathmandu, Nepal, Monday, April 27, 2015.

entry.title: Expats try phones, social apps to connect to quake-hit Nepal
entry.summary: After the earthquake hit Nepal, Prem Raja Mahat spent a sleepless night at his Baltimore home, trying again and again to reach his son, who was visiting friends and family back in Mahat's home country.

entry.title: Quake-aid need acute in Nepal capital, more so in villages
entry.summary: Nepalese victims of Saturday's earthquake lie inside an Indian air force helicopter as they are evacuated from Trishuli Bazar to Kathmandu airport in Nepal, Monday, April 27, 2015.

entry.title: Death toll in Nepal quake reaches 3,726 - official
entry.summary: KATHMANDU, April 27 (Reuters) - The number of people killed in Nepal by the Himalayan country's worst earthquake in eight decades has risen to 3,726, a home ministry official said on Monday.

entry.title: The Latest on Nepal Quake: Aid worker in epicenter district
entry.summary: Nepal's police say at least 3,617 people have been confirmed killed in Saturday's earthquake, including 1,302 in the Kathmandu Valley alone.

Rescue teams' members identify bodies dug out of the collapsed Sitapyla church in Kathmandu, Nepal, Monday, April 27, 2015.

entry.title: Quake-aid need acute in Nepal capital, more so in villages
entry.summary: A strong magnitude 7.8 earthquake shook Nepal's capital and the densely populated Kathmandu Valley on Saturday, causing extensive damage with toppled walls and collapsed buildings.

entry.title: Deaths rise, aid flown in after Nepal quake: Things to Know
entry.summary: Locals take snapshots with their cell phones at the historic Dharahara Tower, a city landmark, that was damaged in Saturday's earthquake in Kathmandu, Nepal, Monday, April 27, 2015.

entry.title: Deaths Rise, Aid Flown in After Nepal Quake: Things to Know

entry.title: The Latest on Nepal Quake: Gorkha toll could change picture
entry.summary: Japan says it will provide emergency relief goods such as tents and blankets worth 25 million yen ($210,000) to Nepal, through the Japan International Cooperation Agency following the massive earthquake on Saturday.

entry.title: The Latest on Nepal Quake: Gorkha Toll Could Change Picture
entry.summary: The Israeli military said it is sending a search and rescue crew to Nepal on Monday to help locate survivors in the rubble, set up a medical field hospital for locals, and bring Israeli travelers home.

entry.title: The Latest on Nepal Quake: Entire army involved in rescue
entry.summary:
She says the team will also assist with humanitarian assessments to support Nepal's government and the international relief efforts.

Kathmandu district chief administrator Ek Narayan Aryal says tents and water are being handed at 10 locations in Nepal's capital, but that the many aftershocks were leaving everyone jittery.

entry.title: The Latest on Nepal Quake: Gorkha toll could change picture
entry.summary: A strong magnitude earthquake shook Nepal's capital and the densely populated Kathmandu valley on Saturday devastating the region and leaving tens of thousands shell-shocked and sleeping in streets.

entry.title: No time to lose: Global response to Nepal quake gears up
entry.summary:
The United Arab Emirates deployed an 88-member search-and-rescue team to Nepal Sunday, and the Emirates Red Crescent also sent a team.

The Israeli military said it is sending a 260-member mission to Nepal to provide immediate search-and-rescue help and medical aid.

entry.title: No time to lose: Global response to Nepal quake gears up
entry.summary:
Members of a German rescue organization board a plane at the airport in Frankfurt, central Germany, Sunday, April 26, 2015, for their flight to earthquake-torn Nepal.

International Search and Rescue Germany says a team of 52 relief workers including doctors, experts trained in searching for people buried under rubble and several dog squads will fly to Nepal.

entry.title: How to help Nepal earthquake victims
entry.summary: Aid groups are rushing to get crucial supplies to survivors of Nepal's devastating earthquake, which has killed more than 2,500 people.

entry.title: Nepal earthquake: no reports of Britons killed or injured, says Foreign Office
entry.summary: The British Foreign Office has received no reports of British nationals being killed or injured in the Nepal earthquake, but said it has helped hundreds of people.

entry.title: Nepal earthquake: climbers trapped on Mount Everest 'getting desperate'
entry.summary: The aftershock occurred around 1pm Nepal time Sunday and registered 6.7 on the Richter scale, according to the US Geological Survey.

entry.title: 3 U.S. Citizens Among Dead In Avalanche After Nepal Quake

entry.summary: Nepal authorities said Sunday that at least 2,430 people died in that country alone, not including the 18 dead in the avalanche.

entry.title: Nepal earthquake: Video emerges of moment avalanche hit Everest base camp

entry.title: More than 830 Australians safe in Nepal
entry.summary: Authorities have confirmed more than 830 Australians in Nepal are safe after a devastating earthquake in the country.

entry.summary: At least 5,000 people were injured across Nepal.

entry.title: No power, comms for Nepal quake rescuers

entry.title: Nepal soccer head stands down during FIFA financial probe
entry.summary: The 90-day sanction bars All Nepal Football Association president Ganesh Thapa from attending the Asian Football Confederation election congress in Bahrain on April 30.

entry.title: Nepal soccer head stands down during FIFA financial probe
entry.summary:
FIFA says Nepal's top soccer official has extended his self-imposed ban while the governing body's ethics committee investigates possible financial wrongdoing.

Thapa has led Nepal's soccer body for two decades.

entry.title: Everest Climbers Forced to Quit Last Year to Get New Permits
entry.summary: Nepal has cleared more than 300 mountaineers to climb Mount Everest after they had to abandon last year's efforts when an ice avalanche killed 16 guides in the mountain's deadliest disaster, an official said Friday.

entry.title: Nepal to give new Everest climbing permits to hundreds forced to quit after tragedy last year
entry.summary:
The head of Nepal's tourism department, Tulasi Gautam, says the government is extending last year's permits without charging new fees.

Nepal also pledged recently to improve weather forecasting, security and rescue efforts, and has cut climbing fees this year to $11,000 per climber from $25,000.

entry.title: Nepal jails man for 35 years for rape, murder of 7-year-old
entry.summary:
The sentences are the maximum allowed for those offenses in Nepal.

Menuka Thapa of Raksha Nepal, an organization that supports sexually exploited girls in Nepal, said people are also more educated now and more cases are being reported.

entry.title: Nepal jails man for 35 years for rape, murder of 7-year-old
entry.summary:
A court in southern Nepal has sentenced a man to 35 years in prison for the rape and murder of a 7-year-old girl, officials said Wednesday, in a case that sparked outrage in the Himalayan nation.

There are conflicting data on sexual crimes in Nepal, but rights groups say the number of rape cases in the country has increased in recent years.

entry.title: Nepal boosts doctors, rescue efforts at Everest base camp
entry.summary: Nepal was criticized for not having a rescue plan during disasters or any government presence at the base camp despite charging climbers huge permit fees.

entry.title: Nepal boosts doctors, rescue efforts at Everest base camp
entry.summary: Four doctors, up from two or three in the past, will be stationed at the base camp's emergency room tent, which will be equipped to handle almost any medical need, said Devi Bahadur Koirala of the Himalayan Rescue Association Nepal.

entry.title: Nepal airport reopens after runway cleared
entry.summary:
KATHMANDU, Nepal (AP) " Nepal's only international airport reopened four days after a Turkish Airlines jet skidded and blocked the single runway, the aviation authority said Sunday.

Nepal's government said it will wave visa fees for the stranded passengers.

entry.title: Turkish Airlines jet carrying 238 passengers crash lands after over-shooting runway in Nepal?
entry.summary: The only international airport in Nepal remained closed Wednesday morning after the accident.

entry.title: Turkish Airlines plane skids off Nepal runway
Too much human poo on Mount Everest says Nepal
entry.summary: Hundreds of foreign climbers attempt to scale Everest during Nepal's mountaineering season, which began this week and runs through May. Last year's season was canceled after 16 local guides were killed in an avalanche in April.

entry.title: Nepal official says human waste on Everest a major problem
entry.summary:
KATHMANDU, Nepal (AP) " Human waste left by climbers on Mount Everest has become a problem that is causing pollution and threatening to spread disease on the world's highest peak, the chief of Nepal's mountaineering association said Tuesday.

He said Nepal's government needs to get the climbers to dispose of the waste properly so the mountain remains pristine.

Nepal's government has not come up with a plan yet to tackle the issue of human waste.
